definition: drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: People are clapping, slapping their thighs, stomping the floor.
sentences.chinese: 人們鼓掌，拍着大腿，跺着地板。

sentences.english: Thunderous ovations were accorded the two leaders.
sentences.chinese: 這兩位領導受到雷鳴般的鼓掌歡呼。

sentences.english: They called the actor before the curtain.
sentences.chinese: 他們鼓掌要求這位演員出來謝幕。

sentences.english: The audience, which was most enthusiastic applauded the soloist.
sentences.chinese: 極爲熱情的觀衆爲那位獨唱演員熱烈鼓掌。

sentences.english: The audience rose to the dancers.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆起立向舞蹈演員熱烈鼓掌。

sentences.english: He merely stood and watched his father while clapping politely.
sentences.chinese: 他只是站在那裏看着他的父親，禮貌性地鼓鼓掌。
宗教領袖們鼓掌表示同意他的意見。
那時在這裏可沒有人鼓掌。

sentences.english: He sings terribly, out of tune now and then, but I still have to applaud.
sentences.chinese: 他唱得真不怎麼樣，經常走調，不過我還得鼓掌叫好。

sentences.english: People laughed and clapped their hands as the horses and the lion tamer performed.
sentences.chinese: 當馴馬和馴獅者表演時，人們笑着拍手鼓掌。

sentences.english: I kept hearing the sound of applause in the background.
sentences.chinese: 我不斷聽到隱約的鼓掌聲。

sentences.english: The performance was warmly applauded and cheered over and over by the audience.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆對演出一再熱烈鼓掌歡呼。

sentences.english: After Mr. Zhang's speech, all the audience stood up and applauded.
sentences.chinese: 當張先生的演講結束時，所有人都起身鼓掌了。

sentences.english: The audience clapped the famous pianist heartily.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆向這位著名的鋼琴家熱情地鼓掌。

sentences.english: She came down beaming, and the entire class applauded.
sentences.chinese: 她高興地下來了，全班學生都爲他鼓掌。

sentences.english: The President was welcomed at the airport with loud applause.
sentences.chinese: 總統在機場受到了熱烈的鼓掌歡迎。

definition: to clap one's hands/to clap each other's hands/high five
to boo or jeer (as a sign of displeasure at an actor)
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
(idiom) a good person, used to praise sb's moral integrity or courage
